artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Inoue Mohei; Carver: Ōta Tashichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 323; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 139, p. 294.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three separate sheets; long blue, black and white bridge over water; pink fireworks in sky, center and left; horses, carts, buggies and people on bridge, in predominately red and purple garments; many boats on water; boat in LLQ has red lanterns with black characters
dimension: 14 1/8 × 9 3/4 in. (35.88 × 24.77 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
markings: Carver’s seal: 彫工秀勝堂 {horikō Hidekatsu-dō}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 応需大蘇芳年 {ōju Taiso Yoshitoshi}
title: Picture of the Ryōgoku Bridge in Tokyo
